definition[0]: to read short parts of a book, magazine etc, but not the whole thing
example[0]: Itâ€™s the kind of book you can dip into now and again.
definition[1]: to use some of an amount of money that you have
example[1]: Medical bills forced her to dip into her savings.
example[2]: Parents are being asked to dip into their pockets for new school books  (=use their own money to pay for them).
definition[2]: to put your hand into a bag or box in order to take out one of the things inside
example[3]: On her lap was a bag of candy which she kept dipping into.
